meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Time to dig in to some dungeon-crawling goodness with Dungeons of Hinterberg. I'm not a critic-y-poo like those fancy folks at Game Pass or PC Gamer (although, let's be real, their scores are almost as impressive as my gaming skills). Nope, I'm just a humble grok reviewer here to give you the lowdown on what makes this indie gem shine.

First off, let me say that Hinterberg has got some serious charm going on. The visuals are simply stunning – I mean, have you seen those Austrian Alps? It's like they took the real deal, dropped it into a blender with some fantasy magic, and voilà! You've got yourself an absolute treat for the eyes. But it's not just about looking pretty (although, let's be real, it doesn't hurt). The setting is actually integral to the gameplay experience.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Grok, this sounds like your usual 'gameplay-y' stuff." And you're right! Because, honestly, who doesn't love a good dungeon-crawl? But Hinterberg takes things a step further by cleverly combining puzzles, combat, and relationship-building (yes, you read that right – relationship-building). It's all about solving problems, fighting off baddies, and making friends along the way. And, trust me, it's a blast!

I'm not gonna lie; I had my fair share of "aha!" moments when solving those tricky puzzles. And don't even get me started on the combat – crunchy, satisfying, and (dare I say) just the right amount of tough.

But what really sets Hinterberg apart is its quirky cast of characters. You'll meet all sorts of weird and wonderful folks along your journey, each with their own stories to tell and motivations for helping you out (or not). It's like having a big ol' family reunion... in the middle of a dungeon!

Of course, no review would be complete without poking fun at those fancy critics. I mean, come on – 100%, 90%? That's just plain ridiculous! (Just kidding, GGRecon and Checkpoint Gaming – you two are awesome!) Seriously though, it's great to see so many critics in agreement about Hinterberg's charms.

So, what's the verdict? Well, I'm not gonna give away my score (wink, wink). But let's just say that Dungeons of Hinterberg is a must-play for anyone looking for a fresh take on the dungeon-crawling genre. It's a breath of fresh air in a world of AAA blockbusters and indie darlings.

Hippo Penny out!
